modules.name: large_language_models_and_agents
recommendedLiterature: Zhou et al.: A Comprehensive Survey on Pretrained Foundation Models: A History from BERT to ChatGPT. 2023.
Zhao et al.: A Survey of Large Language Models. 2024.
Wang et al.: A Survey on Large Language Model based Autonomous Agents. 2024.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basic machine learning concepts and techniques

modules.name: advanced_process_mining
recommendedLiterature: Wil van der Aalst: Process Mining: Data Science in Action, 2nd edition (Recommended)
Josep Carmona et al. Conformance checking, 1st edition (Recommended)
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Familiarity with Petri nets and BPMN for process modeling; Basic programming in Python.

modules.name: advanced_methods_in_text_analytics
recommendedLiterature: Dan Jurafsky and James H. Martin, Speech and Language Processing: An Introduction to Natural Language Processing, Computational Linguistics, and Speech Recognition (3rd edition)
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Successful completion of basic methods of linear algebra and probability theory.

modules.name: higher_level_computer_vision
recommendedLiterature: Goodfellow et al.: Deep Learning, MIT Press, 2016.
R. Szeliski: Computer Vision Algorithms and Applications, Springer, 2010.
D. Forsyth, J. Ponce: Computer Vision: A Modern Approach, Prentice Hall, 2nd edition, 2012.
R. Hartley, A. Zisserman: Multiple View Geometry in Computer Vision, Cambridge University Press, 2nd edition, 2004.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basis skills in linear algebra, knowledge in python and pytorch.

modules.name: image_processing
recommendedLiterature: R. Szeliski: Computer Vision Algorithms and Applications, Springer, 2010.
D. Forsyth, J. Ponce: Computer Vision: A Modern Approach, Prentice Hall, 2nd edition, 2012.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basis skills in linear algebra, knowledge in python.

modules.name: generative_computer_vision_models
recommendedLiterature: Ian Goodfellow and Yoshua Bengio and Aaron Courville, Deep Learning, An MIT press book, 2016.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basis skills in linear algebra, knowledge in python/pytorch.

modules.name: machine_learning_and_causal_inference
recommendedLiterature: Angrist, Joshua D., and Jörn-Steffen Pischke. 2009. Mostly Harmless Econometrics: An Empiricist’s Companion.
Murphy, Kevin P. 2012. Machine Learning: A Probabilistic Perspective.
Hastie, Trevor, Robert Tibshirani, and Jerome Friedman. 2008. The Elements of Statistical Learning. 2nd ed.
Imbens, Guido W., and Donald B. Rubin. 2015. Causal Inference for Statistics, Social, and Biomedical Sciences: An Introduction.
Morgan, Stephen L., and Christopher Winship. 2007. Counterfactuals and Causal Inference.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: A sound understanding of basic statistical methods.
